com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: Analytics is a struct that represents the analytics server and the requests that should be sent to it. This information is sent to Loft instances when they check in with the license server.

endpoint.description: Endpoint is the endpoint for the analytics server.

requests.description: Requests is a slice of requested resources to return analytics for.

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: Announcement contains an announcement that should be shown within the Loft instance. This information is sent to Loft instances when they check in with the license server.

body.description: Body contains the main message of the announcement in HTML format.

buttons.description: Buttons to show alongside the announcement

name.description: Name contains the resource name of the announcement

title.description: Title contains the title of the announcement in HTML format.

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: BlockRequest tells the instance to block certain requests due to overages (limit exceeded) the license server.

resource.description: Resource is the resource name for the request.

verbs.description: Verbs is the list of verbs for the request.

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: Button is an object that represents a button in the Loft UI that links to some external service for handling operations for licensing for example.

direct.description: Direct indicates if the Loft front end should directly hit this endpoint. If false, it means that the Loft front end will be hitting the license server first to generate a one time token for the operation; this also means that there will be a redirect URL in the response to the request for this and that link should be followed by the front end.

displayText.description: DisplayText is the text to display on the button. If display text is unset the button will never be shown in the loft UI.

name.description: Name is the name of the button (ButtonName). Optional.

url.description: URL is the link at the other end of the button.

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: Feature contains information regarding to a feature

allowBefore.description: AllowBefore is an optional timestamp. If set, licenses issued before this time are allowed to use the feature even if it's not included in the license.

module.description: Name of the module that this feature belongs to

name.description: Name is the name of the feature (FeatureName) This cannot be FeatureName because it needs to be downward compatible e.g. older Loft version doesn't know a newer feature but it will still be received and still needs to be rendered in the license view

preview.description: Preview represents whether the feature can be previewed if a user's license does not allow the feature

status.description: Status shows the status of the feature (see type FeatureStatus)

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: FeatureUsage holds information about whether a feature is used and its status
Invoice provides details about an invoice

currency.description: Currency specifies the currency of Total in 3-character ISO 4217 code Default is: "" (representing USD)

date.description: Date contains the unix timestamp marking the date this invoices was or will be created

total.description: Total is the total of the invoice

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: License is a struct representing the license data sent to a Loft instance after checking in with the license server.

analytics.description: Analytics indicates the analytics endpoints and which requests should be sent to the analytics server.

annotations.description: Annotations contains additional metadata about the license.

announcement.description: Announcements is a map string/string such that we can easily add any additional data without needing to change types. For now, we will use the keys "name" and "content".

block.description: BlockRequests specifies which requests the product should block when a limit is exceeded.

buttons.description: Buttons is a slice of license server endpoints (buttons) that the Loft instance may need to hit. Each Button contains the display text and link for the front end to work with.

domainToken.description: DomainToken holds the JWT with the URL that the Loft instance is publicly available on. (via Loft router)

entity.description: Entity holds a name for an organization, person or entity this product is licensed for. This will be displayed to the user.

instance.description: InstanceID contains the instance id of the Loft instance

isOffline.description: IsOffline indicates if the license is an offline license or not.

modules.description: Modules is a list of modules.

plans.description: Plans contains a list of plans

usageData.description: Usage data contains  resource usage information for a platform deployment

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: LicenseAPIRoute is a single route of the license api

direct.description: Tells the frontend whether to make a direct request or to make it via the backend (via generic license api request)

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: LicenseAPIRoutes contains all key routes of the license api
Limit defines a limit set in the license

displayName.description: DisplayName is for display purposes.

module.description: Name of the module that this limit belongs to

name.description: Name is the name of the resource (ResourceName)

quantity.description: Limit specifies the limit for this resource.

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: Module is a struct representing a module of the product

name.description: Name of the module (ModuleName)

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: NodeInfo holds information about a single node
Plan definition

addons.description: AddOns are plans that can be added to this plan

displayName.description: DisplayName is the display name of the plan

features.description: Features is a list of features included in the plan

invoice.description: UpcomingInvoice provides a preview of the next invoice that will be created for this Plan

limits.description: Limits is a list of resources included in the plan and their limits

period.description: Period provides information about the plan's current period This is nil unless this is the active plan

prices.description: Prices provides details about the available prices (depending on the interval, for example)

status.description: Status is the status of the plan There should only be 1 active plan at the top-level (not including AddOns) The respective price in Prices will have the active status as well

trial.description: Trial provides details about a planned, ongoing or expired trial

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: PlanExpiration provides details about the expiration of a plan

expiresAt.description: ExpiresAt is the unix timestamp of when the plan expires

upgradesTo.description: UpgradesTo states the name of the plan that is replacing the current one upon its expiration If this is nil, then this plan just expires (i.e. the subscription may be canceled, paused, etc.)

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: PlanPeriod provides details about the period of the plan

end.description: CurrentPeriodEnd contains the unix timestamp marking the end of the current period

start.description: CurrentPeriodStart contains the unix timestamp marking the start of the current period

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: PlanPrice defines a price for the plan

exp.description: Expiration provides information about when this plan expires

interval.description: Interval contains the time span of each period (e.g. month, year)

intervalCount.description: IntervalCount specifies if the number of intervals (e.g. 3 [months])

quantity.description: Quantity sets the quantity the TierResource is supposed to be at If this is the active price, then this is the subscription quantity (currently purchased quantity)

resource.description: TierResource provides details about the main resource the tier quantity relates to This may be nil for plans that don't have their quantity tied to a resource

status.description: Status is the status of the price (PlanStatus) If the plan is active, one of its prices must be active as well

tierMode.description: TierMode defines how tiers should be used

tiers.description: Tiers is a list of tiers in this plan

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: PlatformDatabase contains information about the local platform database installation
PriceTier defines a tier within a plan

currency.description: Currency specifies the currency of UnitPrice and FlatFee in 3-character ISO 4217 code Default is: "" (representing USD)

flatFee.description: FlatFee is the flat fee for this tier

max.description: MaxQuantity is the max quantity that can be purchased

min.description: MinQuantity is the quantity included in this plan

unitPrice.description: UnitPrice is the price per unit in this tier

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: Request represents a request analytics information for an apigroup/resource and a list of verb actions for that resource.

resource.description: Resource is the resource name for the request.

verbs.description: Verbs is the list of verbs for the request.

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: ResourceCount stores the number of existing, active and total number of resources created.

active.description: Active specifies the number of currently active resource (non-sleeping).

committed.description: Committed specifies the amount of resource consumption customers have committed to for a given billing period. It can be exceeded and will then be charged with overage fees.

created.description: TotalCreated is a continuous counter of the amount of resources ever created.

total.description: Total specifies the number of currently existing resources.

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: TierResource provides details about the main resource the tier quantity relates to

name.description: Name of the resource (ResourceName)

status.description: Status defines which resources will be counted towards the limit (e.g. active, total, total created etc.)

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: Trial represents a trial

displayName.description: DisplayName is a display name for the trial

downgradesTo.description: DowngradesTo states the name of the plan that is replacing the current one once the trial expires If this is nil, then this plan just expires (i.e. the subscription may be canceled, paused, etc.)

end.description: End is the unix timestamp stating when the trial will end or ended

id.description: ID is the unique id of this trial

start.description: Start is the unix timestamp stating when the trial was started

status.description: Status is the status of this trial (TrialStatus)

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: UsageData holds information for an instance deployment of vCluster Platform

details.description: Details contains the details of the usage data

featureUsage.description: FeatureUsage contains the usage of features

resourceUsage.description: ResourceUsage contains the usage of resources

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: UsageDataDetails holds detailed information about the nodes and virtual cluster for an instance deployment of vCluster Platform

nodes.description: Nodes contains the details of the nodes

vClusters.description: VClusters contains the details of the virtual clusters

com.github.loft-sh.admin-apis.pkg.licens.description: VirtualClusterInfo holds information about a single virtual cluster

clusterRole.description: ClusterRole is the cluster role to use for this job

image.description: Image is the image to use for this app

script.description: Script is the script to execute.

insecureSkipTlsVerify.description: If tls certificate checks for the chart download should be skipped

name.description: Name is the chart name in the repository

password.description: The password that is required for this repository

passwordRef.description: The password that is required for this repository

repoURL.description: RepoURL is the repo url where the chart can be found

username.description: The username that is required for this repository

usernameRef.description: The username that is required for this repository

version.description: Version is the chart version in the repository

slept.description: Amount of milliseconds the space has slept in the epoch

start.description: Timestamp when the epoch has started

annotations.description: Annotations are extra annotations for this helm release

bash.description: Bash holds the bash script to execute in a container in the target

chart.description: Chart holds information about a chart that should get deployed

manifests.description: Manifests holds kube manifests that will be deployed as a chart

parameters.description: Parameters are additional helm chart values that will get merged with config and are then used to deploy the helm chart.

values.description: Values is the set of extra Values added to the chart. These values merge with the default values inside of the chart. You can use golang templating in here with values from parameters.

chart.description: Chart holds information about a chart that should get deployed

manifests.description: Manifests holds kube manifests that will be deployed as a chart

info.description: Info provides information about a release

metadata.description: Metadata provides information about a chart

version.description: Revision is an int which represents the revision of the release.

deleted.description: Deleted tracks when this object was deleted.

description.description: Description is human-friendly "log entry" about this release.

first_deployed.description: FirstDeployed is when the release was first deployed.

last_deployed.description: LastDeployed is when the release was last deployed.

notes.description: Contains the rendered templates/NOTES.txt if available

status.description: Status is the current state of the release

com.github.loft-sh.agentapi.v4.pkg.apis..description: LastActivityInfo holds information about the last activity

apiGroup.description: APIGroup is the api group that was used for the request

host.description: Host is the host where this activity was recorded

metricsRefreshInterval.description: MetricsRefreshInterval is the activity refresh interval. This is used to prevent sleeping instances if the last activity metrics have not been refreshed within the interval. Useful for metrics based activty tracking.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource

resource.description: Resource is the resource of the request

subject.description: Subject is the user or team where this activity was recorded

subresource.description: Subresource is the subresource of the request

verb.description: Verb is the verb that was used for the request

virtualCluster.description: VirtualCluster is the virtual cluster this activity happened in

email.description: Email is an optional email address to contact the named maintainer

name.description: Name is a user name or organization name

url.description: URL is an optional URL to an address for the named maintainer

com.github.loft-sh.agentapi.v4.pkg.apis..description: Metadata for a Chart file. This models the structure of a Chart.yaml file.

annotations.description: Annotations are additional mappings uninterpreted by Helm, made available for inspection by other applications.

apiVersion.description: The API Version of this chart.

appVersion.description: The version of the application enclosed inside of this chart.

condition.description: The condition to check to enable chart

deprecated.description: Whether or not this chart is deprecated

description.description: A one-sentence description of the chart

home.description: The URL to a relevant project page, git repo, or contact person

icon.description: The URL to an icon file.

kubeVersion.description: KubeVersion is a SemVer constraint specifying the version of Kubernetes required.

maintainers.description: A list of name and URL/email address combinations for the maintainer(s)

name.description: The name of the chart

sources.description: Source is the URL to the source code of this chart

tags.description: The tags to check to enable chart

type.description: Specifies the chart type: application or library

urls.description: Urls where to find the chart contents

version.description: A SemVer 2 conformant version string of the chart

key.description: Key of the project secret to use.

name.description: Name of the project secret to use.

project.description: Project is the project name where the secret is located in.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

deleteAfter.description: DeleteAfter specifies after how many seconds of inactivity the space should be deleted

forceSleep.description: If force sleep is true the space will sleep

forceSleepDuration.description: If force sleep duration is set, this will force the space to sleep for the given duration. It also implies that forceSleep is true. During this period loft will also block certain requests to that space. If this is set to 0, it means the space will sleep until it is manually woken up via the cli or ui.

ignoreActiveConnections.description: IgnoreActiveConnections ignores active connections on the namespace

ignoreResourceNames.description: IgnoreResourceNames are ignored resources and names

ignoreUserAgents.description: IgnoreUseragents are ignored user agents with trailing wildcards '*' allowed. comma separated

sleepAfter.description: SleepAfter specifies after how many seconds of inactivity the space should sleep

sleepSchedule.description: SleepSchedule specifies scheduled space sleep in Cron format, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron. Note: timezone defined in the schedule string will be ignored. Use ".Spec.Timezone" field instead.

timezone.description: Timezone specifies time zone used for scheduled space operations. Defaults to UTC. Accepts the same format as time.LoadLocation() in Go (https://pkg.go.dev/time#LoadLocation). The value should be a location name corresponding to a file in the IANA Time Zone database, such as "America/New_York". See also: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

wakeupSchedule.description: WakeupSchedule specifies scheduled wakeup from sleep in Cron format, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron. Note: timezone defined in the schedule string will be ignored. Use ".Spec.Timezone" field instead.

currentEpoch.description: Optional info that indicates how long the space was sleeping in the current epoch

lastActivity.description: LastActivity indicates the last activity in the namespace

lastActivityInfo.description: LastActivityInfo holds information about the last activity within this space

lastEpoch.description: Optional info that indicates how long the space was sleeping in the current epoch

scheduledSleep.description: Indicates time of the next scheduled sleep based on .Spec.SleepSchedule and .Spec.ScheduleTimeZone The time is a Unix time, the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 UTC

scheduledWakeup.description: Indicates time of the next scheduled wakeup based on .Spec.WakeupSchedule and .Spec.ScheduleTimeZone The time is a Unix time, the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 UTC

sleepType.description: SleepType specifies a type of sleep, which has effect on which actions will cause the space to wake up.

sleepingSince.description: SleepingSince specifies since when the space is sleeping (if this is not specified, loft assumes the space is not sleeping)

sleptLastSevenDays.description: This is a calculated field that will be returned but not saved and describes the percentage since the space was created or the last 7 days the space has slept

sleptLastThirtyDays.description: This is a calculated field that will be returned but not saved and describes the percentage since the space was created or the last 30 days the space has slept

com.github.loft-sh.agentapi.v4.pkg.apis..description: ClusterQuota is the Schema for the cluster quotas api

com.github.loft-sh.agentapi.v4.pkg.apis..description: ClusterQuotaSpec defines the desired state of ClusterQuota

project.description: Project is the project that this cluster quota should apply to

quota.description: quota is the quota definition with all the limits and selectors

team.description: Team is the name of the team this quota should apply to

user.description: User is the name of the user this quota should apply to

com.github.loft-sh.agentapi.v4.pkg.apis..description: ClusterQuotaStatus defines the observed state of ClusterQuota

namespaces.description: Namespaces slices the usage by project.  This division allows for quick resolution of deletion reconciliation inside of a single project without requiring a recalculation across all projects.  This can be used to pull the deltas for a given project.

total.description: Total defines the actual enforced quota and its current usage across all projects

com.github.loft-sh.agentapi.v4.pkg.apis..description: ClusterQuotaStatusByNamespace holds the status of a specific namespace

namespace.description: Namespace of the account this account quota applies to

status.description: Status indicates how many resources have been consumed by this project

com.github.loft-sh.agentapi.v4.pkg.apis..description: Condition defines an observation of a Cluster API resource operational state.

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another. This should be when the underlying condition changed. If that is not known, then using the time when the API field changed is acceptable.

message.description: A human readable message indicating details about the transition. This field may be empty.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition in CamelCase. The specific API may choose whether this field is considered a guaranteed API. This field may not be empty.

severity.description: Severity provides an explicit classification of Reason code, so the users or machines can immediately understand the current situation and act accordingly. The Severity field MUST be set only when Status=False.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

type.description: Type of condition in CamelCase or in foo.example.com/CamelCase. Many .condition.type values are consistent across resources like Available, but because arbitrary conditions can be useful (see .node.status.conditions), the ability to deconflict is important.

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with an audit event that may be set by plugins invoked in the request serving chain, including authentication, authorization and admission plugins. Note that these annotations are for the audit event, and do not correspond to the metadata.annotations of the submitted object. Keys should uniquely identify the informing component to avoid name collisions (e.g. podsecuritypolicy.admission.k8s.io/policy). Values should be short. Annotations are included in the Metadata level.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

auditID.description: Unique audit ID, generated for each request.

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

level.description: AuditLevel at which event was generated

objectRef.description: Object reference this request is targeted at. Does not apply for List-type requests, or non-resource requests.

requestObject.description: API object from the request, in JSON format. The RequestObject is recorded as-is in the request (possibly re-encoded as JSON), prior to version conversion, defaulting, admission or merging. It is an external versioned object type, and may not be a valid object on its own. Omitted for non-resource requests.  Only logged at Request Level and higher.

requestReceivedTimestamp.description: Time the request reached the apiserver.

requestURI.description: RequestURI is the request URI as sent by the client to a server.

responseObject.description: API object returned in the response, in JSON. The ResponseObject is recorded after conversion to the external type, and serialized as JSON.  Omitted for non-resource requests.  Only logged at Response Level.

responseStatus.description: The response status. For successful and non-successful responses, this will only include the Code and StatusSuccess. For panic type error responses, this will be auto-populated with the error Message.

sourceIPs.description: Source IPs, from where the request originated and intermediate proxies.

stage.description: Stage of the request handling when this event instance was generated.

stageTimestamp.description: Time the request reached current audit stage.

userAgent.description: UserAgent records the user agent string reported by the client. Note that the UserAgent is provided by the client, and must not be trusted.

verb.description: Verb is the kubernetes verb associated with the request. For non-resource requests, this is the lower-cased HTTP method.

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.audit.description: ObjectReference contains enough information to let you inspect or modify the referred object.

apiGroup.description: APIGroup is the name of the API group that contains the referred object. The empty string represents the core API group.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion is the version of the API group that contains the referred object.

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.manag.description: AgentAnalyticsSpec holds info the agent can use to send analytics data to the analytics backend.

compress.description: Compress determines if the rotated log files should be compressed using gzip. The default is not to perform compression.

disableAgentSyncBack.description: If true, the agent will not send back any audit logs to Loft itself.

enabled.description: If audit is enabled and incoming api requests will be logged based on the supplied policy.

level.description: Level is an optional log level for audit logs. Cannot be used together with policy

maxAge.description: MaxAge is the maximum number of days to retain old log files based on the timestamp encoded in their filename.  Note that a day is defined as 24 hours and may not exactly correspond to calendar days due to daylight savings, leap seconds, etc. The default is not to remove old log files based on age.

maxBackups.description: MaxBackups is the maximum number of old log files to retain.  The default is to retain all old log files (though MaxAge may still cause them to get deleted.)

maxSize.description: MaxSize is the maximum size in megabytes of the log file before it gets rotated. It defaults to 100 megabytes.

path.description: The path where to save the audit log files. This is required if audit is enabled. Backup log files will be retained in the same directory.

policy.description: The audit policy to use and log requests. By default loft will not log anything

access.description: Access holds the access rights for users and teams

clusters.description: Clusters are the clusters this app can be installed in.

config.description: Config is the helm config to use to deploy the helm release

defaultNamespace.description: DefaultNamespace is the default namespace this app should installed in.

description.description: Description describes an app

displayName.description: DisplayName is the name that should be displayed in the UI

helm.description: DEPRECATED: Use config instead helm defines the configuration for a helm deployment

icon.description: Icon holds an URL to the app icon

manifests.description: DEPRECATED: Use config instead manifest represents kubernetes resources that will be deployed into the target namespace

owner.description: Owner holds the owner of this object

parameters.description: Parameters define additional app parameters that will set helm values

readme.description: Readme is a longer markdown string that describes the app.

recommendedApp.description: RecommendedApp specifies where this app should show up as recommended app

streamContainer.description: DEPRECATED: Use config.bash instead StreamContainer can be used to stream a containers logs instead of the helm output.

timeout.description: Timeout is the time to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks) (default 5m0s)

versions.description: Versions are different app versions that can be referenced

wait.description: Wait determines if Loft should wait during deploy for the app to become ready

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.manag.description: Apps holds configuration for apps that should be shown

noDefault.description: If this option is true, loft will not try to parse the default apps

predefinedApps.description: Predefined apps that can be selected in the Spaces > Space menu

repositories.description: These are additional repositories that are parsed by loft

displayName.description: DisplayName is the name of the object to display in the UI

kind.description: Kind is the type of resource used to establish the assignment. One of `User`, `Team`, or `ClusterAccess`

name.description: Name of the referenced object

namespace.description: Namespace of the referenced object

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.manag.description: Audit holds the audit configuration options for loft. Changing any options will require a loft restart to take effect.

compress.description: Compress determines if the rotated log files should be compressed using gzip. The default is not to perform compression.

dataStoreEndpoint.description: DataStoreEndpoint is an endpoint to store events in.

dataStoreTTL.description: DataStoreMaxAge is the maximum number of hours to retain old log events in the datastore

disableAgentSyncBack.description: If true, the agent will not send back any audit logs to Loft itself.

enabled.description: If audit is enabled and incoming api requests will be logged based on the supplied policy.

level.description: Level is an optional log level for audit logs. Cannot be used together with policy

maxAge.description: MaxAge is the maximum number of days to retain old log files based on the timestamp encoded in their filename.  Note that a day is defined as 24 hours and may not exactly correspond to calendar days due to daylight savings, leap seconds, etc. The default is not to remove old log files based on age.

maxBackups.description: MaxBackups is the maximum number of old log files to retain.  The default is to retain all old log files (though MaxAge may still cause them to get deleted.)

maxSize.description: MaxSize is the maximum size in megabytes of the log file before it gets rotated. It defaults to 100 megabytes.

path.description: The path where to save the audit log files. This is required if audit is enabled. Backup log files will be retained in the same directory.

policy.description: The audit policy to use and log requests. By default loft will not log anything

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.manag.description: AuditPolicy describes the audit policy to use for loft

omitStages.description: OmitStages is a list of stages for which no events are created. Note that this can also be specified per rule in which case the union of both are omitted.

rules.description: Rules specify the audit Level a request should be recorded at. A request may match multiple rules, in which case the FIRST matching rule is used. The default audit level is None, but can be overridden by a catch-all rule at the end of the list. PolicyRules are strictly ordered.

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.manag.description: AuditPolicyRule describes a policy for auditing

clusters.description: Clusters that this rule matches. Only applies to cluster requests. If this is set, no events for non cluster requests will be created. An empty list means no restrictions will apply.

level.description: The Level that requests matching this rule are recorded at.

namespaces.description: Namespaces that this rule matches. The empty string "" matches non-namespaced resources. An empty list implies every namespace.

nonResourceURLs.description:
NonResourceURLs is a set of URL paths that should be audited. *s are allowed, but only as the full, final step in the path. Examples:
 "/metrics" - Log requests for apiserver metrics
 "/healthz*" - Log all health checks

omitStages.description: OmitStages is a list of stages for which no events are created. Note that this can also be specified policy wide in which case the union of both are omitted. An empty list means no restrictions will apply.

requestTargets.description: RequestTargets is a list of request targets for which events are created. An empty list implies every request.

resources.description: Resources that this rule matches. An empty list implies all kinds in all API groups.

userGroups.description: The user groups this rule applies to. A user is considered matching if it is a member of any of the UserGroups. An empty list implies every user group.

users.description: The users (by authenticated user name) this rule applies to. An empty list implies every user.

verbs.description: The verbs that match this rule. An empty list implies every verb.

accessKeyMaxTTLSeconds.description: AccessKeyMaxTTLSeconds is the global maximum lifespan of an accesskey in seconds. Leaving it 0 or unspecified will disable it. Specifying 2592000 will mean all keys have a Time-To-Live of 30 days.

connectors.description: Connectors are optional additional connectors for Loft.

customHttpHeaders.description: CustomHttpHeaders are additional headers that should be set for the authentication endpoints

disableTeamCreation.description: Prevents from team creation for the new groups associated with the user at the time of logging in through sso, Default behaviour is false, this means that teams will be created for new groups.

disableUserCreation.description: DisableUserCreation prevents the SSO connectors from creating a new user on a users initial signin through sso. Default behaviour is false, this means that a new user object will be created once a user without a Kubernetes user object logs in.

groupsFilters.description: GroupsFilters is a regex expression to only save matching sso groups into the user resource

loginAccessKeyTTLSeconds.description: LoginAccessKeyTTLSeconds is the time in seconds an access key is kept until it is deleted. Leaving it unspecified will default to 20 days. Setting it to zero will disable the ttl. Specifying 2592000 will mean all keys have a  default Time-To-Live of 30 days.

password.description: Password holds password authentication relevant information

rancher.description: Rancher holds the rancher authentication options

clientId.description: ClientID holds the github client id

clientSecret.description: ClientID holds the github client secret

hostName.description: Required ONLY for GitHub Enterprise. This is the Hostname of the GitHub Enterprise account listed on the management console. Ensure this domain is routable on your network.

orgs.description:
Loft queries the following organizations for group information. Group claims are formatted as "(org):(team)". For example if a user is part of the "engineering" team of the "coreos" org, the group claim would include "coreos:engineering".

If orgs are specified in the config then user MUST be a member of at least one of the specified orgs to authenticate with loft.

redirectURI.description: RedirectURI holds the redirect URI. Should be https://loft.domain.tld/auth/github/callback

rootCA.description: ONLY for GitHub Enterprise. Optional field. Used to support self-signed or untrusted CA root certificates.

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.manag.description: AuthenticationGithubOrg holds org-team filters, in which teams are optional.

name.description: Organization name in github (not slug, full name). Only users in this github organization can authenticate.

teams.description: Names of teams in a github organization. A user will be able to authenticate if they are members of at least one of these teams. Users in the organization can authenticate if this field is omitted from the config file.

groups.description: Optional groups whitelist, communicated through the "groups" scope. If `groups` is omitted, all of the user's GitLab groups are returned. If `groups` is provided, this acts as a whitelist - only the user's GitLab groups that are in the configured `groups` below will go into the groups claim. Conversely, if the user is not in any of the configured `groups`, the user will not be authenticated.

adminEmail.description: Required if ServiceAccountFilePath The email of a GSuite super user which the service account will impersonate when listing groups

groups.description: Optional list of whitelisted groups If this field is nonempty, only users from a listed group will be allowed to log in

hostedDomains.description: Optional list of whitelisted domains If this field is nonempty, only users from a listed domain will be allowed to log in

serviceAccountFilePath.description: Optional path to service account json If nonempty, and groups claim is made, will use authentication from file to check groups with the admin directory api

groups.description: It is possible to require a user to be a member of a particular group in order to be successfully authenticated in loft.

onlySecurityGroups.description: configuration option restricts the list to include only security groups. By default all groups (security, Office 365, mailing lists) are included.

tenant.description:
tenant configuration parameter controls what kinds of accounts may be authenticated in loft. By default, all types of Microsoft accounts (consumers and organizations) can authenticate in loft via Microsoft. To change this, set the tenant parameter to one of the following:

common - both personal and business/school accounts can authenticate in loft via Microsoft (default) consumers - only personal accounts can authenticate in loft organizations - only business/school accounts can authenticate in loft tenant uuid or tenant name - only accounts belonging to specific tenant identified by either tenant uuid or tenant name can authenticate in loft

useGroupsAsWhitelist.description: Restrict the groups claims to include only the users groups that are in the configured groups

allowedExtraClaims.description: AllowedExtraClaims are claims of interest that are not part of User by default but may be provided by the OIDC provider.

caFile.description: Path to a PEM encoded root certificate of the provider. Optional

clientId.description:
ClientID the JWT must be issued for, the "sub" field. This plugin only trusts a single client to ensure the plugin can be used with public providers.

The plugin supports the "authorized party" OpenID Connect claim, which allows specialized providers to issue tokens to a client for a different client. See: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDToken

clientSecret.description: ClientSecret to issue tokens from the OIDC provider

emailClaim.description: EmailClaim is the JWT field to use as the user's email.

getUserInfo.description: GetUserInfo, if specified, tells the OIDCAuthenticator to try to populate the user's information from the UserInfo.

groups.description: If required groups is non empty, access is denied if the user is not part of at least one of the specified groups.

groupsClaim.description: GroupsClaim, if specified, causes the OIDCAuthenticator to try to populate the user's groups with an ID Token field. If the GroupsClaim field is present in an ID Token the value must be a string or list of strings.

groupsPrefix.description: GroupsPrefix, if specified, causes claims mapping to group names to be prefixed with the value. A value "oidc:" would result in groups like "oidc:engineering" and "oidc:marketing".

insecureCa.description: Specify whether to communicate without validating SSL certificates

issuerUrl.description:
IssuerURL is the URL the provider signs ID Tokens as. This will be the "iss" field of all tokens produced by the provider and is used for configuration discovery.

The URL is usually the provider's URL without a path, for example "https://accounts.google.com" or "https://login.salesforce.com".

The provider must implement configuration discovery. See: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html#ProviderConfig

loftUsernameClaim.description: LoftUsernameClaim is the JWT field to use as the user's username.

postLogoutRedirectURI.description: Loft URI to be redirected to after successful logout by OIDC Provider

preferredUsername.description: Configurable key which contains the preferred username claims

resource.description: Resource, if specified, is the value that is set for the "resource" URL parameter when making a request to the /token endpoint of the OIDC provider.

scopes.description: Scopes that should be sent to the server. If empty, defaults to "email" and "profile".

type.description: Type of the OIDC to show in the UI. Only for displaying purposes

usernameClaim.description: UsernameClaim is the JWT field to use as the user's id.

usernamePrefix.description: UsernamePrefix, if specified, causes claims mapping to username to be prefix with the provided value. A value "oidc:" would result in usernames like "oidc:john".

disabled.description: If true login via password is disabled

bearerToken.description: BearerToken holds the rancher API key in token username and password form. E.g. my-token:my-secret

host.description: Host holds the rancher host, e.g. my-domain.com

insecure.description: Insecure tells Loft if the Rancher endpoint is insecure.

allowedGroups.description: List of groups to filter access based on membership

ca.description: CA to use when validating the signature of the SAML response.

caData.description: CAData is a base64 encoded string that holds the ca certificate for validating the signature of the SAML response. Either CAData, CA or InsecureSkipSignatureValidation needs to be defined.

emailAttr.description: Name of attribute in the returned assertions to map to email

entityIssuer.description: When provided Loft will include this as the Issuer value during AuthnRequest. It will also override the redirectURI as the required audience when evaluating AudienceRestriction elements in the response.

filterGroups.description: If used with allowed groups, only forwards the allowed groups and not all groups specified.

groupsAttr.description: Name of attribute in the returned assertions to map to groups

groupsDelim.description: If GroupsDelim is supplied the connector assumes groups are returned as a single string instead of multiple attribute values. This delimiter will be used split the groups string.

nameIDPolicyFormat.description:
Requested format of the NameID. The NameID value is is mapped to the ID Token 'sub' claim.

This can be an abbreviated form of the full URI with just the last component. For example, if this value is set to "emailAddress" the format will resolve to:

		urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress

If no value is specified, this value defaults to:

		urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:persistent

redirectURI.description: If the response assertion status value contains a Destination element, it must match this value exactly. Usually looks like https://your-loft-domain/auth/saml/callback

ssoIssuer.description: Issuer value expected in the SAML response. Optional.

ssoURL.description: SSO URL used for POST value.

usernameAttr.description: Name of attribute in the returned assertions to map to username

loftHost.description: LoftHost holds the domain where the loft instance is hosted. This should not include https or http. E.g. loft.my-domain.com

oidc.description: DEPRECATED: Configure the OIDC clients using either the OIDC Client UI or a secret. By default, vCluster Platform as an OIDC Provider is enabled but does not function without OIDC clients.

platformDB.description: PlatformDB holds the settings related to the postgres database that platform uses to store data

projectNamespacePrefix.description: ProjectNamespacePrefix holds the prefix for loft project namespaces. Omitted defaults to "p-"

uiSettings.description: UISettings holds the settings for modifying the Loft user interface

vault.description: VaultIntegration holds the vault integration configuration

displayName.description: DisplayName is the name that should show up in the ui

id.description: ID is the id that should show up in the url

values.description: Values are the config values for the virtual cluster

converted.description: Converted signals if the Values have been converted from the old format

values.description: Values are the converted config values for the virtual cluster

cluster.description: Cluster are settings for each cluster's managed components. These settings apply to all connected clusters unless overridden by modifying the Cluster's spec

enabled.description: Enabled specifies whether the ROI dashboard should be available in the UI, and if the metrics infrastructure that provides dashboard data is deployed

global.description: Global are settings for globally managed components

settings.description: Settings specify price-related settings that are taken into account for the ROI dashboard calculations.

metrics.description: Metrics are settings applied to metric infrastructure in each connected cluster. These can be overridden in individual clusters by modifying the Cluster's spec

opencost.description: OpenCost are settings applied to OpenCost deployments in each connected cluster. These can be overridden in individual clusters by modifying the Cluster's spec

averageGPUPrice.description: AvgGPUPrice specifies the average GPU price.

enabled.description: Enabled specifies whether GPU settings should be available in the UI.

metrics.description: Metrics these settings apply to metric infrastructure used to aggregate metrics across all connected clusters

timePeriod.description: TimePeriod specifies the time period for the price.

averageCPUPricePerNode.description: AvgCPUPricePerNode specifies the average CPU price per node.

averageRAMPricePerNode.description: AvgRAMPricePerNode specifies the average RAM price per node.

controlPlanePricePerCluster.description: ControlPlanePricePerCluster specifies the price of one physical cluster.

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with an audit event that may be set by plugins invoked in the request serving chain, including authentication, authorization and admission plugins. Note that these annotations are for the audit event, and do not correspond to the metadata.annotations of the submitted object. Keys should uniquely identify the informing component to avoid name collisions (e.g. podsecuritypolicy.admission.k8s.io/policy). Values should be short. Annotations are included in the Metadata level.

The RequestObject is recorded as-is in the request (possibly re-encoded as JSON), prior to version conversion, defaulting, admission or merging. It is an external versioned object type, and may not be a valid object on its own. Omitted for non-resource requests.  Only logged at Request Level and higher.

stageTimestamp.description: Time the request reached current audit stage.

userAgent.description: UserAgent records the user agent string reported by the client. Note that the UserAgent is provided by the client, and must not be trusted.

verb.description: Verb is the kubernetes verb associated with the request. For non-resource requests, this is the lower-cased HTTP method.

allowBefore.description: AllowBefore is an optional timestamp. If set, licenses issued before this time are allowed to use the feature even if it's not included in the license.

internal.description: Internal marks internal features that should not be shown on the license view

module.description: Name of the module that this feature belongs to

name.description: Name is the name of the feature (FeatureName) This cannot be FeatureName because it needs to be downward compatible e.g. older Loft version doesn't know a newer feature but it will still be received and still needs to be rendered in the license view

preview.description: Preview represents whether the feature can be previewed if a user's license does not allow the feature

status.description: Status shows the status of the feature (see type FeatureStatus)

used.description: Used marks features that are currently used in the product

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.manag.description: GroupResources represents resource kinds in an API group.

group.description: Group is the name of the API group that contains the resources. The empty string represents the core API group.

resourceNames.description: ResourceNames is a list of resource instance names that the policy matches. Using this field requires Resources to be specified. An empty list implies that every instance of the resource is matched.

resources.description:
Resources is a list of resources this rule applies to.

For example: 'pods' matches pods. 'pods/log' matches the log subresource of pods. '*' matches all resources and their subresources. 'pods/*' matches all subresources of pods. '*/scale' matches all scale subresources.

If wildcard is present, the validation rule will ensure resources do not overlap with each other.

An empty list implies all resources and subresources in this API groups apply.

enabled.description: Enabled specifies whether the remote image builder should be available. If it's not available building ad-hoc images from a devcontainer.json is not supported

replicas.description: Replicas is the number of desired replicas.

resources.description: Resources are compute resource required by the buildkit containers

timeWindow.description: TimeWindow specifies the time window for the maintenance. It should be a string representing the time range in 24-hour format, in UTC, e.g., "02:00-03:00".

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.manag.description: NodeClaimSpec defines spec of node claim.

controlPlane.description: ControlPlane indicates if the node claim is for a control plane node. This is intentionally not omitempty as we want to ensure that the control plane is always set for easier checking in for example terraform templates.

desiredCapacity.description: DesiredCapacity specifies the resources requested by the NodeClaim.

kubeletArgs.description: KubeletArgs are additional arguments to pass to the kubelet.

properties.description: Properties are extra properties for the NodeClaim.

providerRef.description: ProviderRef is the name of the NodeProvider that this NodeClaim is based on.

requirements.description: Requirements are the requirements for the NodeClaim.

startupTaints.description: StartupTaints are taints that are applied to nodes upon startup which are expected to be removed automatically within a short period of time, typically by a DaemonSet that tolerates the taint. These are commonly used by daemonsets to allow initialization and enforce startup ordering.  StartupTaints are ignored for provisioning purposes in that pods are not required to tolerate a StartupTaint in order to have nodes provisioned for them.

taints.description: Taints will be applied to the NodeClaim's node.

typeRef.description: TypeRef is the full name of the NodeType that this NodeClaim is based on.

vClusterRef.description: VClusterRef references source vCluster. This is required.

conditions.description: Conditions describe the current state of the platform NodeClaim.

message.description: Message describes the reason in human-readable form

phase.description: Phase is the current lifecycle phase of the NodeClaim.

reason.description: Reason describes the reason in machine-readable form

bcm.description: BCM configures a node provider for BCM Bare Metal Cloud environments.

clusterAPI.description: ClusterAPI configures a node provider using Cluster API, enabling nodes to be provisioned using Cluster API. This requires the vCluster to be deployed with Cluster API as well.

displayName.description: DisplayName is the name that should be displayed in the UI

kubeVirt.description: Kubevirt configures a node provider using KubeVirt, enabling virtual machines to be provisioned as nodes within a vCluster.

properties.description: Properties are global properties that are applied to all node claims and environments managed by this provider.

terraform.description: Terraform configures a node provider using Terraform, enabling nodes to be provisioned using Terraform.

displayName.description: DisplayName is the name that should be displayed in the UI

overhead.description: Overhead defines the resource overhead for this node type.

properties.description: Properties returns a flexible set of properties that may be selected for scheduling.

providerRef.description: ProviderRef is the node provider to use for this node type.

resources.description: Resources lists the full resources for a single node.

capacity.description: Capacity is the capacity of the node type.

conditions.description: Conditions holds several conditions the node type might be in

cost.description: Cost is the calculated instance cost from the resources specified or the price specified from spec. The higher the cost, the less likely it is to be selected.

phase.description: Phase is the current lifecycle phase of the NodeType.

reason.description: Reason describes the reason in machine-readable form

requirements.description: Requirements is the calculated requirements based of the properties for the node type.

allowed.description: Allowed is required. True if the action would be allowed, false otherwise.

denied.description: Denied is optional. True if the action would be denied, otherwise false. If both allowed is false and denied is false, then the authorizer has no opinion on whether to authorize the action. Denied may not be true if Allowed is true.

evaluationError.description: EvaluationError is an indication that some error occurred during the authorization check. It is entirely possible to get an error and be able to continue determine authorization status in spite of it. For instance, RBAC can be missing a role, but enough roles are still present and bound to reason about the request.

reason.description: Reason is optional.  It indicates why a request was allowed or denied.

user.description: User is the user you're testing for. If you specify "User" but not "Groups", then is it interpreted as "What if User were not a member of any groups

allowed.description: Allowed is required. True if the action would be allowed, false otherwise.

denied.description: Denied is optional. True if the action would be denied, otherwise false. If both allowed is false and denied is false, then the authorizer has no opinion on whether to authorize the action. Denied may not be true if Allowed is true.

evaluationError.description: EvaluationError is an indication that some error occurred during the authorization check. It is entirely possible to get an error and be able to continue determine authorization status in spite of it. For instance, RBAC can be missing a role, but enough roles are still present and bound to reason about the request.

reason.description: Reason is optional.  It indicates why a request was allowed or denied.

containerState.description: DEPRECATED: This is not set anymore after migrating to runners ContainerState describes the container state of the task

observedGeneration.description: ObservedGeneration is the latest generation observed by the controller.

podPhase.description:
PodPhase describes the phase this task is in

Possible enum values:
 - `"Failed"` means that all containers in the pod have terminated, and at least one container has terminated in a failure (exited with a non-zero exit code or was stopped by the system).
 - `"Pending"` means the pod has been accepted by the system, but one or more of the containers has not been started. This includes time before being bound to a node, as well as time spent pulling images onto the host.
 - `"Running"` means the pod has been bound to a node and all of the containers have been started. At least one container is still running or is in the process of being restarted.
 - `"Succeeded"` means that all containers in the pod have voluntarily terminated with a container exit code of 0, and the system is not going to restart any of these containers.
 - `"Unknown"` means that for some reason the state of the pod could not be obtained, typically due to an error in communicating with the host of the pod. Deprecated: It isn't being set since 2015 (74da3b14b0c0f658b3bb8d2def5094686d0e9095)

started.description: Started determines if the task was started

connector.description: Connector specifies the secret that should be used to connect to an external database server. The connection is used to manage a user and database for the vCluster. A data source endpoint constructed from the created user and database is returned on status. The secret specified by connector should contain the following fields: endpoint - the endpoint where the database server can be accessed user - the database username password - the password for the database username port - the port to be used in conjunction with the endpoint to connect to the databse server. This is commonly 3306

dataSource.description: DataSource holds a datasource endpoint constructed from the vCluster's designated user and database. The user and database are created from the given connector.

identityProvider.description: IdentityProvider is the kine identity provider to use when generating temporary authentication tokens for enhanced security.

certificateTTL.description: CertificateTTL holds the ttl (in seconds) to set for the certificate associated with the returned kubeconfig. This field is optional, if no value is provided, the certificate TTL will be set to one day. If set to zero, this will cause loft to pass nil to the certificate signing request, which will result in the certificate being valid for the clusters `cluster-signing-duration` value which is typically one year.

clientCert.description: ClientCert, if set to true, will return kube config with generated client certs instead of platform token

server.description: Server allows user to override server in the kubeconfig.

access.description: Access to the virtual cluster object itself

clusterRef.description: ClusterRef is the reference to the connected cluster holding this virtual cluster

description.description: Description describes a virtual cluster instance

displayName.description: DisplayName is the name that should be displayed in the UI

external.description: External specifies if the virtual cluster is managed by the platform agent or externally.

extraAccessRules.description: ExtraAccessRules defines extra rules which users and teams should have which access to the virtual cluster.

networkPeer.description: NetworkPeer specifies if the cluster is connected via tailscale.

owner.description: Owner holds the owner of this object

parameters.description: Parameters are values to pass to the template. The values should be encoded as YAML string where each parameter is represented as a top-level field key.

standalone.description: Standalone specifies if the virtual cluster is standalone and not hosted in another Kubernetes cluster.

template.description: Template is the inline template to use for virtual cluster creation. This is mutually exclusive with templateRef.

templateRef.description: TemplateRef holds the virtual cluster template reference

canUpdate.description: CanUpdate specifies if the requester can update the instance

canUse.description: CanUse specifies if the requester can use the instance

conditions.description: Conditions holds several conditions the virtual cluster might be in

deployHash.description: DeployHash is the hash of the last deployed values.

ignoreReconciliation.description: IgnoreReconciliation tells the controller to ignore reconciliation for this instance -- this is primarily used when migrating virtual cluster instances from project to project; this prevents a situation where there are two virtual cluster instances representing the same virtual cluster which could cause issues with concurrent reconciliations of the same object. Once the virtual cluster instance has been cloned and placed into the new project, this (the "old") virtual cluster instance can safely be deleted.

kubernetesVersion.description: KubernetesVersion is the Kubernetes version of the virtual cluster.

message.description: Message describes the reason in human-readable form why the cluster is in the current phase

online.description: Online specifies if there is at least one network peer available for an agentless vCluster.

phase.description: Phase describes the current phase the virtual cluster instance is in

reason.description: Reason describes the reason in machine-readable form why the cluster is in the current phase

serviceUID.description: ServiceUID is the service uid of the virtual cluster to uniquely identify it.

sleepModeConfig.description: SleepModeConfig is the sleep mode config of the space. This will only be shown in the front end.

spaceObjects.description: SpaceObjects are the objects that were applied within the virtual cluster space

virtualCluster.description: VirtualCluster is the template rendered with all the parameters

virtualClusterObjects.description: VirtualClusterObjects are the objects that were applied within the virtual cluster itself

allowLoftCli.description:
AllowLoftCLI allows certain read-only management requests to make sure loft cli works correctly with this specific access key.

Deprecated: Use the `roles` field instead
 ```yaml
 # Example:
 roles:
   - role: loftCLI
 ```

clusters.description: Clusters specifies the project cluster the access key is allowed to access.

projects.description: Projects specifies the projects the access key should have access to.

roles.description: Roles is a set of managed permissions to apply to the access key.

rules.description: DEPRECATED: Use Projects, Spaces and VirtualClusters instead Rules specifies the rules that should apply to the access key.

spaces.description: Spaces specifies the spaces the access key is allowed to access.

virtualClusters.description: VirtualClusters specifies the virtual clusters the access key is allowed to access.

cluster.description: Cluster is the name of the cluster to access. You can specify * to select all clusters.

project.description: Project is the name of the project. You can specify * to select all projects.

projects.description: Projects specifies the projects the access key should have access to.

role.description:
Role is the name of the role to apply to the access key scope.

Possible enum values:
 - `"agent"`
 - `"loft-cli"`
 - `"network-peer"`
 - `"runner"`
 - `"vcluster"`
 - `"workspace"`

virtualClusters.description: VirtualClusters specifies the virtual clusters the access key is allowed to access.

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.stora.description: AccessKeyScopeRule describes a rule for the access key

cluster.description: Cluster that this rule matches. Only applies to cluster requests. If this is set, no requests for non cluster requests are allowed. An empty cluster means no restrictions will apply.

namespaces.description: Namespaces that this rule matches. The empty string "" matches non-namespaced resources. An empty list implies every namespace.

nonResourceURLs.description:
NonResourceURLs is a set of URL paths that should be checked. *s are allowed, but only as the full, final step in the path. Examples:
 "/metrics" - Log requests for apiserver metrics
 "/healthz*" - Log all health checks

requestTargets.description: RequestTargets is a list of request targets that are allowed. An empty list implies every request.

resources.description: Resources that this rule matches. An empty list implies all kinds in all API groups.

verbs.description: The verbs that match this rule. An empty list implies every verb.

virtualClusters.description: VirtualClusters that this rule matches. Only applies to virtual cluster requests. An empty list means no restrictions will apply.

project.description: Project is the name of the project.

space.description: Space is the name of the space. You can specify * to select all spaces.

options.description: Options is a slice of strings, where each string represents a mutually exclusive choice.

required.description: Required specifies if this parameter is required

type.description: Type of the parameter. Can be one of: string, multiline, boolean, number and password

validation.description: Validation regex that if matched will allow the input

variable.description: Variable is the path of the variable. Can be foo or foo.bar for nested objects.

hash.description: Hash is the hash of the app configuration

namespace.description: Namespace specifies in which target namespace the app should get deployed in

appReference.description: AppReference is the reference to the app to deploy

rollbackRevision.description: RollbackRevision is the revision to rollback to

type.description: Type is the task type. Defaults to Upgrade

defaultNamespace.description: DefaultNamespace is the default namespace this app should installed in.

icon.description: Icon holds an URL to the app icon

parameters.description: Parameters define additional app parameters that will set helm values

readme.description: Readme is a longer markdown string that describes the app.

streamContainer.description: DEPRECATED: Use config.bash instead StreamContainer can be used to stream a containers logs instead of the helm output.

timeout.description: Timeout is the time to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks) (default 5m0s)

version.description: Version is the version. Needs to be in X.X.X format.

wait.description: Wait determines if Loft should wait during deploy for the app to become ready

cluster.description: Cluster defines the name of the cluster that ArgoCD is deployed into -- if not provided this will default to 'loft-cluster'.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if the ArgoCD Integration is enabled for the project -- this knob only enables the syncing of virtualclusters, but does not enable SSO integration or project creation (see subsequent spec sections!).

namespace.description: Namespace defines the namespace in which ArgoCD is running in the cluster.

project.description: Project defines project related values for the ArgoCD Integration. Enabling Project integration will cause Loft to generate and manage an ArgoCD appProject that corresponds to the Loft Project.

sso.description: SSO defines single-sign-on related values for the ArgoCD Integration. Enabling SSO will allow users to authenticate to ArgoCD via Loft.

virtualClusterInstance.description: VirtualClusterInstance defines the name of *virtual cluster* (instance) that ArgoCD is deployed into. If provided, Cluster will be ignored and Loft will assume that ArgoCD is running in the specified virtual cluster.

application.description: Application is the ArgoCD project/repository to apply the rule to.

permission.description: Allow applies the "allow" permission to the rule, if allow is not set, the permission will always be set to "deny".

description.description: Description to add to the ArgoCD project.

groups.description: Groups is a list of OIDC group names to bind to the role.

name.description: Name of the ArgoCD role to attach to the project.

rules.description: Rules ist a list of policy rules to attach to the role.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if the ArgoCD Project Integration is enabled for this project. Enabling this will cause Loft to create an appProject in ArgoCD that is associated with the Loft Project. When Project integration is enabled Loft will override the default assigned role set in the SSO integration spec.

metadata.description: Metadata defines additional metadata to attach to the loft created project in ArgoCD.

roles.description: Roles is a list of roles that should be attached to the ArgoCD project. If roles are provided no loft default roles will be set. If no roles are provided *and* SSO is enabled, loft will configure sane default values.

sourceRepos.description: SourceRepos is a list of source repositories to attach/allow on the project, if not specified will be "*" indicating all source repositories.

description.description: Description to add to the ArgoCD project.

extraAnnotations.description: ExtraAnnotations are optional annotations that can be attached to the project in ArgoCD.

extraLabels.description: ExtraLabels are optional labels that can be attached to the project in ArgoCD.

assignedRoles.description: AssignedRoles is a list of roles to assign for users who authenticate via Loft -- by default this will be the `read-only` role. If any roles are provided this will override the default setting.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if the ArgoCD SSO Integration is enabled for this project. Enabling this will cause Loft to configure SSO authentication via Loft in ArgoCD. If Projects are *not* enabled, all users associated with this Project will be assigned either the 'read-only' (default) role, *or* the roles set under the AssignedRoles field.

host.description: Host defines the ArgoCD host address that will be used for OIDC authentication between loft and ArgoCD. If not specified OIDC integration will be skipped, but vclusters/spaces will still be synced to ArgoCD.

cost.description: Cost is the instance cost. The higher the cost, the less likely it is to be selected. If empty, cost is automatically calculated from the resources specified.

com.github.loft-sh.api.v4.pkg.apis.stora.description: GroupResources represents resource kinds in an API group.

group.description: Group is the name of the API group that contains the resources. The empty string represents the core API group.

resourceNames.description: ResourceNames is a list of resource instance names that the policy matches. Using this field requires Resources to be specified. An empty list implies that every instance of the resource is matched.

resources.description:
Resources is a list of resources this rule applies to.

For example: 'pods' matches pods. 'pods/log' matches the log subresource of pods. '*' matches all resources and their subresources. 'pods/*' matches all subresources of pods. '*/scale' matches all scale subresources.

If wildcard is present, the validation rule will ensure resources do not overlap with each other.

An empty list implies all resources and subresources in this API groups apply.

capacity.description: Capacity is the capacity of the node type.

conditions.description: Conditions holds several conditions the node type might be in

cost.description: Cost is the calculated instance cost from the resources specified or the price specified from spec. The higher the cost, the less likely it is to be selected.

message.description: Message describes the reason in human-readable form

lastAppliedObjects.description: LastAppliedObjects holds the status for the objects that were applied

replicas.description: Replicas is the number of desired replicas.

resources.description: Resources are compute resource required by the OpenCost backend

project.description: Project is the quota status for the whole project

user.description:
User is the quota status for each user / team. An example status could look like this: status:
  quotas:
    user:
      limit:
        pods: "10"
        spaces: "5"
      users:
        admin:
          used:
            spaces: "3"  # <- calculated in our apiserver
            pods: "8"    # <- the sum calculated from clusters
      clusters:
        cluster-1:  # <- populated by agent from cluster-1
          users:
            admin:
              pods: "3"
        cluster-2:
          users:
            admin:
              pods: "5"

clusters.description: Clusters holds the used amount per cluster. Maps cluster name to used resources

limit.description: Limit is the amount limited, copied from spec.quotas.project

used.description: Used is the amount currently used across all clusters
Used is the amount currently used. Maps resource name, such as pods, to their used amount.

Secret data should contain the `token` key.

syncInterval.description: SyncInterval defines the interval at which to sync secrets from Vault. Defaults to `1m.` See https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration for supported formats.
